page.title: 06THE AREA COVERED
page.content: The area is mostly farmland with a fairly high proportion of it arble despite the hilly nature. The rough pasture is used to graze sheep. There are a number of amenities within the area. A golf course of nine holes just to the west of Selkirk. On the highest point is the Slkirk Transmitter which broadcasts television to the surrounding area. Whitmuir Hall is a holiday self catering accomodation with some facilities for entertainment within the Hall. Their is an old resrevoir which is used for fishing. The main road which runs through the area is the A799 selkirk to St Boswells where the Regional Council have their Headquarters.
